document_data.name: Focal Stone
document_data.refs3e: {{Cite web/Wyrms of the North/Valamaradace, "the Dragon Queen"}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Focal stone''''' was a [[divine magic|divine]] [[alteration]]/[[transmutation]] [[spell]] from the [[elemental earth sphere]] that the structure of a clear or translucent [[gem stones|gem stone]], enabling it to receive the ''[[dweomer]]'' of a [[spell]].
document_data.Effects: The stone in question could not be larger than the caster's balled fist. Gemstones of higher quality stood a better chance of success. The spell dweomer was usually added via ''[[dweomerflow]]''. When cast, the gemstone would glow internally. All ''focal stones'', regardless of the spell they held, could receive the life force from a ''[[magic jar]]'', could ''[[neutralize poison]]'' if placed into the liquid, and commanded to do so. When submerged in a poisonous or toxic liquid, such stones turned a vibrant purple color. However, doing so would destroy the ''focal stone''. Shattering a ''focal stone'' would release the full effects of the store spell.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, this spell required as a [[material component]] a pinch of [[opal]] dust.
document_data.Usage: The ancient [[gold dragon]] [[Valamaradace]] used this spell, along with ''[[abeyance]]'' and multiple castings of ''[[greater levitate]]'' to keep her private sanctuary, the [[earthmote]] known as the [[Floating Mountain]], aloft in the skies over [[the North]].
document_data.History: This was an extremely rare spell on [[Toril]].
